newsitem.title: Australia: RTRS-Australian bonds back to outperforming ways.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian bonds back to outperforming ways.

text.p: Australian bonds went back into their outperforming ways against U.S. bonds, which have featured since April, as the local market started to build the expectation of a subdued inflation report this week.

The Australian/U.S. 10-year spread was heading towards 100 basis points, a level it briefly broke before last week's hawkish RBA quarterly Bulletin when it subsequently widened out to some around 115 basis points.

"We expect spreads to come back in this week and certainly in the run-up to the CPI number, but it will probably be a bit more defensive after CPI becuase of the relative risk on the wages being higher than expected," said Bruce Hockman, senior economist at Bain and Co.
The September quarter headline CPI and underlying inflation reports are due on Wednesday, while the August quarter average weekly ordinary time earnings (AWOTE) are due Thursday.
Traders said that given the emphasis of concern that the RBA put on its concerns over wages, AWOTE could prove to be the key data of the week.

Today's spread tightening was more apparent against the U.S. and Canada, but the market was narrowly mixed against New Zealand debt, which continued last week's strong post-election rally, spurred on by strong New Zealand dollar.
